critique: The document describes the appointment of Mrs. Daphne Mary Byrne as a clerk-typist. It mentions her deceased husband, Joseph V. Byrne, a veteran who died from a service-connected disability. The language is formal and factual. There is a hint of sadness due to the mention of Mr. Byrne's death and service-connected disability. There is a slight sense of joy that Mrs. Byrne is being appointed to a position. There is no indication of anger, fear, disgust, or surprise.
